thread.title: Northwestern roasting Vanderbilt alum Skip Bayless is the best moment of the year so far
thread.title_full: Northwestern roasting Vanderbilt alum Skip Bayless is the best moment of the year so far

author: Alex Kirshner
title: Northwestern roasting Vanderbilt alum Skip Bayless is the best moment of the year so far
text:
Game, set, match.
1. Skip Bayless went to Vanderbilt. 
2. Skip Bayless sounded quite certain Vanderbilt would beat Northwestern on Thursday, in Northwestern’s first NCAA tournament game ever.
Vanderbilt drops anchor on Northwestern's fairy tale. Better school, better alumni, better ex-player coach, far better basketball tradition.
— Skip Bayless (@RealSkipBayless) March 12, 2017 3. Northwestern beat Vanderbilt .
4. Northwestern’s Twitter account leapt from the top rope.
We hear you, @Twitter . But not *everyone* in the media went to @NorthwesternU . #B1GCats | #PoundTheRock | #ItsTime https://t.co/hOR1GXAvOj 
— #B1GCats (@NU_Sports) March 16, 2017 Northwestern’s got a lot of alums in the sports media, who went to its prestigious Medill journalism school. Northwestern’s exciting season has made a lot of these media members happy, and their insatiable rooting on of their alma mater has become a sort of running gag on the broader sports media scene.
Chalk this one up as Northwestern’s second win over Vanderbilt of the day.
